explanation:
For checking the MISRA rule “a function parameter shall not be modified” you must be sure the parameter pointer variables lbus and ldev themselves are never assigned to (rebound) inside metal_uio_dev_open — and that no called macro expands into such an assignment. Provide the following symbols so the analyzer can verify that: 

- struct linux_bus: to confirm lbus is really a pointer parameter (no macro/typedef surprises) and to spot any name collisions or macro redefinitions that could cause hidden assignments. 
- struct linux_device: to confirm ldev is a pointer parameter, inspect the structure member names (to distinguish field writes from pointer reassignments) and detect any fields that are actually macros or shadow the parameter name. 
- struct linux_driver: prototype/type used when calling metal_uio_dev_bind; needed to check call semantics and whether any macro could rebind ldev/ldrv names. 
- struct dlist: type used with the dlist_for_each_data macro — required to inspect the iteration macro expansion for any assignments to local identifiers that could coincide with parameter names. 
- dlist_for_each_data (macro): macros can expand to code that assigns to local variables; the foreach macro must be inspected to ensure it does not expand to an assignment targeting ldev or lbus. 
- sysfs_open_device: check whether this is a function or a macro; a macro could expand to code that reassigns ldev or lbus (or shadows their names). If a function, its prototype confirms it cannot rebind the caller’s local pointer variable (only mutate pointee data). 
- sysfs_open_directory_list / sysfs_close_list / sysfs_path_is_dir: same reason — ensure none are macros that expand to assignments to the parameter identifiers used in this function. 
- metal_uio_dev_bind: directly called with ldev; need the prototype/definition to verify it is not a macro that (via expansion) reassigns the ldev local variable. Also confirm it is not called with &ldev anywhere (it is not here) and cannot implicitly rebind caller variables. 
- metal_uio_read_map_attr: called with ldev; ensure it is not a macro that reassigns the ldev identifier. 
- metal_map: ensure it is not a macro that could rebind ldev (or other parameter identifiers) when expanded. 
- metal_io_init: ensure it is not a macro that shadows/reassigns local parameter names. 
- metal_linux_irq_register_dev: called with &ldev->device and ldev->fd; check prototype/definition to ensure it is not a macro that expands to an assignment to the ldev parameter name.

In short: obtain definitions/prototypes of the above types, functions and macros to confirm none of them are macros or inline expansions that perform an assignment to the formal parameters lbus or ldev. Field writes to *ldev are permitted by the MISRA rule; only rebinding the pointer variables themselves would be a violation.
